info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 16 at 1:31PM EDT until July 16 at 2:15PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Cabarrus County in the Piedmont of North Carolina... Southeastern Rowan County in the Piedmont of North Carolina... * Until 215 PM EDT. * At 131 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 4 miles southeast of Salisbury, or over Granite Quarry, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Salisbury, China Grove, Granite Quarry, Rockwell, Faith, Gold Hill, High Rock, High Rock Lake and Spencer. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: Brief damaging winds will blow down trees and power lines over small areas. A brief period of large hail is also possible. Seek shelter inside an interior room. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
